programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Murder takes a different perspective when a crime is shown from the viewpoint of a killer. The CSIs investigate two deaths, both linked to the same suspect. As the evidence starts to overlap, the CSI team begins to move in on the murderer.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A woman's branded and emaciated body is discovered in the desert. The investigation soon reveals that the victim is the estranged daughter of Grissom's one-time friend Lady Heather, and that one of the victim's eyeballs isn't her own.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The team explores the case of a man found stuffed down the chimney of a previous suspect's home. Further investigation reveals that the body they found was burned, leading the CSI team to believe the murder was pre-meditated.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A camera crew from a reality series follows the team during the first 48 hours of an investigation involving a real estate agent found dead in her glamorous high-rise apartment. The cameras reveal how the team members deal with the demands of their work.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A sister's stunning courtroom confession throws her brother's guilt into question. Blindsided, the CSIs race to re-examine the case's evidence in order to determine which sibling is telling the truth.

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: When a psychic is found dead in her occult shop, Greg suspects greater forces may be responsible for the woman's demise. However, Grissom steadfastly maintains that science will always crack the case in the end.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Even though the victim was burned beyond recognition, police were able to create a composite sketch from his remains and identify him. Investigators still had to determine where he was killed, however, and who wanted him dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was reported missing after a fight with her husband. She was presumed to be dead and her husband was the prime suspect. Police were suspicious of a secondary suspect when he reported a suspicious fire in his car.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep. There are no signs of trauma or injury, but toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A beautiful young woman is found dead after what seems like a tragic, accidental fall over a cliff. After a closer look at photographs from the scene, police get a new, more sinister theory about the young woman's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murderer thought he could cover his tracks by setting fire to the crime scene, but in doing so, he provided the forensic evidence needed to convict him; a new forensic tool used to examine the kindling proved to be his undoing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: There are no clues to identify a body found along a rural road. Even after a determined detective finds the 'key' to identifying her, it takes a close analysis of a tire tread and a broken piece of jewellery to bring her killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police suspect a man in a hit and run, but he leased the car in question to someone in another state. Police found the vehicle and took it apart, uncovering evidence telling them just what happened.

programme.title: Forensic Files
